710974f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Street (East) - Broadway
710974f-a.text:
Egan Building, b5-o7 East 8th Street, north side, west of Broadway,
seen from the west side of yercer Street at its northern end. This
7-story builcing was erected some time between 1902 and 1910, re-
placing two small houses which had been 7 and 5 Clinton Place (the
street-name and numbering was changed in 1899).
''pick the Oysterman'' occupies the ground floor of No. 65.
March 20, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

710975f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Street (East) - Broadway
710975f-a.text:
137-143 East 8th Street and clearing, north side, between Broadway
and Fourth Aveuue. 145 East 8th Street, the Termania Theatre at
147, and 42-58 Fourth Avenue have been demolished, being directly
in the path of the subway. The houses shown here are also
about to be demolished, and John Wanamaker's thirteen-story build-
ing will be erected here.
The Germania was originally St. Ann's Roman Catholic Church; it was
converted into a theatre in 1879. It was known as Amberg's in
1885 and as the Eighth Street Theatre, a Hobrew playhouse, around
1892.
About 1903.
Br Own Brothers.  Mi6g we 54-
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
